author: A_Brickset_user
title: Unique
review: It is simply hard to rate any old LEGO model below 8...  I love this one for its small size--one of the smallest ever--and the mini figure's blue hat, which I am sure is unique.  What can I say? This little model was really cute.

author: Mawich
title: A small but useful addition
review:
I got this set a year or two after it appeared in the 1982 Lego Catalog.  There isn't much to it but as a kid, any Lego set was a good Lego set in my opinion.  One good thing TLG were good at was releasing sets that kids could afford with pocket money....and this was one of them. 

Some may wonder at the worth of this set but for a handful of $$ you got a minifig and a vehicle which in a small town like I had at the time...was a big deal.

He must have been the hardest working minifig in my town at the time because the streets were always in pristine condition.

author: legotowner
title: Had all the tools to keep the dust out of town
review:
So small and compact, so yellow, so council, so good.

The worker was well respected for his work, well he did have the tools with the shovel and broom which clicked onto the side of his cart.

I thought the front lights being flat under the steering wheel and engine looked so cool.

This was a perfect liitle cheap option that every town needs.

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Cleanest Town Award
review:
Here is a blue capped minifigure - I could not find many others and thats what originally attracted me to this set as a kid. 

Minifigures:
  • A town worker in black trousers, blue top and a flat blue cap.
Done & Dusted
It turned out to be a really good small service vehicle that is colourful and the maintenance worker gets a broom and shovel. Tools and hand gadgets were always much sought after with excitement but are everywhere in modern sets. The red seat was a choice brick and the build was obviously yellow, short but actually satisfying.

Obviously some sort of battery powered electric cart, it can take maintenance within a small range of the town centre. Possibly among the harder working MFs in Town, he deserves a pub to go to after a hard week and perhaps a mug of tea on the job, every workman should have one!

These small town character sets add much to a larger town layout and deserve better attention. Imaginatively this is probably an electric cart and a suitable design but the necessity of vehicles in every Town set is questionable.

Also the necessity of cleaning a town with out dirt raises the need for dirt representative bricks or better still a set that incorporates a real soft brush and vacuum for the one real true enemy of the Lego layout: DUST.

author: Niki124
title: Great little set
review:
Another of Lego's pocket-money sets, this proved to be pocket money well spent in my case. There's always a thrill at finally getting your hands on a long-coveted piece, which for me was the sweeping brush. I also loved the blue peaked cap on the minifigure, and I'll always love the moulded seat pieces.

There aren't many parts so it's a fairly quick build, but there's enough to have a go at making up your own designs and then rebuilding the original. And for our all-important carpet convoys, the original design has ample space for a passenger to hop on the back.

author: Schabee
title: One of the firsts
review:
Background:

This is one of the first sets what I own. I got it on the mid of the '80s. So this has good old memories. The shovel was a long time missing part, steering wheel was broken and the minifigure has no face, till my LEGO love returned and I found the way to replace the parts.

Building experience:

Maybe due to the old memories or just the good idea this is a good set to build. Easy way to get the assembly in one peace. The cleaning devices to attach in the middle of the car is a good way to hold the part.

Parts:

The yellow parts with the red seat is a good idea with the black chassis. Set contains very basic parts. The broom and the shovel is also is a good part of this small set. This set shows how you can build something good from a way simple part.

Playability:

From the view of the few basic bricks of this set you can build various things. 

In the other hand for me this set has not a big playability factor, it is standing always in the car line or the parking lot :)

Value of the money:

As it was a gift from my parents I have no idea of value in the '80s. But today you can get easily very cheap this set from the lot of offers which worth the money you have to pay for it.

Overall:

Most be in the collection of all old LEGOLAND fans and a suggestion for newcomers! :)
